intro: Primula reflexa, commonly known as the reflexed primrose, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Asia and the Himalayas. It typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters, featuring hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers in shades of white, pink, or purple, which bloom in early spring. Its flowers are usually borne on long, slender pedicels, giving it a delicate appearance. Primula reflexa thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in woodland or alpine regions.
